intro: Oxymeris deflexa, commonly known as the flexible oxymeris, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, often drooping branches. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Oxymeris deflexa is adapted to grow in dry, rocky environments and is often found in forest understories.
